text: A devastating, deadlier second wave of coronavirus cases has swept across Europe. Governments reinstated fall lockdowns as they realized that looser rules in the summer may have contributed to thousands of deaths just months before vaccines may arrive. https://t.co/RKpUlXPbil

name: nytimes
text:
This second wave in Europe has become deadlier than the first: Nearly 105,000 people died of Covid-19 there in November, surpassing April’s total, official data shows. 

In most European countries, daily deaths are higher this fall than ever before. https://t.co/RKpUlXPbil https://t.co/9VZWt5bhIF

name: nytimes
text:
Signs of the second wave were appearing in many parts of Europe by mid-August, when cases began to grow at an alarming pace.

name: nytimes
text:
